title: How to Make American Patriotic Popsicles

steps.headline: Prepare the strawberries.
steps.description: Lightly wash them under running water to rinse any dirt off. Hull the strawberries and cut each one of them in half, vertically.

steps.headline: Create the puree.
steps.description: Blend the sugar, strawberries, and lime juice in a food processor.

steps.headline: Strain the mixture in a bowl.
steps.description: Use a wire mesh sieve and strain the strawberry puree through. Use the back of a spoon to press down, making sure you get all the liquid through. Discard any solids left in the sieve.

steps.headline: Freeze the mixture.
steps.description: Pour the mixture into the popsicle molds, about 1/3 filled. Allow it to freeze until the mixture is firm.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients.
steps.description: Combine the sugar, heavy cream, yogurt, and lime juice in a bowl.

steps.headline: Layer the molds.
steps.description: Top the red layer with the white layer, about 1/3 filled.

steps.headline: Freeze the mixture.
steps.description: Place the molds back in the freezer until it's firm.

steps.headline: Create the puree.
steps.description: Blend the sugar, blueberries, and lime juice in a food processor.

steps.headline: Strain the mixture in a bowl.
steps.description: Use a wire mesh sieve and strain the blueberry puree through. Use the back of a spoon to press down, making sure you get all the liquid through. Discard any solids left in the sieve.

steps.headline: Insert the popsicle sticks.
steps.description: Push the sticks through the white layer, making sure you don't crack anything.

steps.headline: Top the popsicle off with the blue layer.
steps.description: Leave about 1/4 of an inch (0.64 cm) from the top for expansion.

steps.headline: Freeze the popsicles.
steps.description: Allow them to freeze for a few hours before consuming.

text: Making the Red Layer Prepare the strawberries. Lightly wash them under running water to rinse any dirt off. Hull the strawberries and cut each one of them in half, vertically. Create the puree. Blend the sugar, strawberries, and lime juice in a food processor. Strain the mixture in a bowl. Use a wire mesh sieve and strain the strawberry puree through. Use the back of a spoon to press down, making sure you get all the liquid through. Discard any solids left in the sieve. Freeze the mixture. Pour the mixture into the popsicle molds, about 1/3 filled. Allow it to freeze until the mixture is firm. Making the White Layer Mix the ingredients. Combine the sugar, heavy cream, yogurt, and lime juice in a bowl. Layer the molds. Top the red layer with the white layer, about 1/3 filled. Freeze the mixture. Place the molds back in the freezer until it's firm. Making the Blue Layer Create the puree. Blend the sugar, blueberries, and lime juice in a food processor. Strain the mixture in a bowl. Use a wire mesh sieve and strain the blueberry puree through. Use the back of a spoon to press down, making sure you get all the liquid through. Discard any solids left in the sieve. Finishing the Popsicles Insert the popsicle sticks. Push the sticks through the white layer, making sure you don't crack anything. Top the popsicle off with the blue layer. Leave about 1/4 of an inch (0.64 cm) from the top for expansion. Freeze the popsicles. Allow them to freeze for a few hours before consuming. Finished.
